t: Proverbs 14
Every*p wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
He*p that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord:*s but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
In*p the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
Where*p no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
A*p faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
A*p scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
Go*p from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
The*p wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
Fools*p make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
The*p heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
The*p house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
There*p is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
Even*p in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
The*p backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
The*p simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
A*p wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
He*p that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
The*p simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
The*p evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
The*p poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
He*p that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
Do*p they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
In*p all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
The*p crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
A*p true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
In*p the fear of the Lord*s is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
In*p the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
He*p that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
A*p sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
He*p that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
The*p wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
Wisdom*p resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
Righteousness*p exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
The*p king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
